com.snamp

Interface TypeConverter<T>


  • public interface TypeConverter<T>
    Represents type converter.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Roman Sakno

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canConvertFrom(java.lang.Class<?> source)
      Determines whether the value of the specified type can be converted into T.
      T convertFrom(java.lang.Object value)
      Converts the value into an instance of T class.
      java.lang.Class<T> getType()
      Returns the type for which this converter is instantiated.

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        java.lang.Class<T> getType()
        Returns the type for which this converter is instantiated.
        Returns:
        The type for which this converter is instantiated.

      • canConvertFrom

        boolean canConvertFrom(java.lang.Class<?> source)
        Determines whether the value of the specified type can be converted into T.
        Parameters:
        source - The type of the source value.
        Returns:
        true, if the value of the specified type can be converted into T; otherwise, false.

      • convertFrom

        T convertFrom(java.lang.Object value)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Converts the value into an instance of T class.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to convert.
        Returns:
        The value of the original type described by this converter.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Unsupported type of the source value. Check the type with canConvertFrom(Class) method.
